title: South-of-the-Border Snapper
summary: South-of-the-Border Snapper is a gluten free, dairy free, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian main course. One portion of this dish contains roughly 23g of protein, 16g of fat, and a total of 268 calories. This recipe serves 4 and costs $2.45 per serving. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. Head to the store and pick up snapper, tequila, oil, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the oil you could follow this main course with the Vegan Mango Banana Bread as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 1 hour and 22 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 51%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include South-of-the-Border Tom Collins, South-of-the-Border Chowder, and South-of-the-border Cod Skillet.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Mark West Pinot Grigio. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 13 dollars.

productMatches.title: Mark West Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description:
Crisp and clean, this wine features honeydew, stone fruit, and citrus with a subtle, clean, lingering finish.
Try pairing with good old fish and chips, summer salads, and steamed clams by the dozen...or dozens.

instructions: Mix all ingredients except fish until well blended.  Reserve 1/4 cup of the dressing mixture; refrigerate until ready to use.                                            Pour remaining dressing mixture over fish in shallow glass or plastic dish; cover.  Refrigerate 30 min. to 1 hour to marinate.  Drain; discard marinade.                                            Preheat greased grill to medium-high heat.  Grill fish 10 to 12 min. or until flakes easily with fork, turning and brushing occasionally with the reserved 1/4 cup dressing mixture.  Serve over hot cooked rice garnished with lime wedges, if desired.

steps.step: Mix all ingredients except fish until well blended.  Reserve 1/4 cup of the dressing mixture; refrigerate until ready to use.
Pour remaining dressing mixture over fish in shallow glass or plastic dish; cover.  Refrigerate 30 min. to 1 hour to marinate.
Preheat greased grill to medium-high heat.  Grill fish 10 to 12 min. or until flakes easily with fork, turning and brushing occasionally with the reserved 1/4 cup dressing mixture.
Serve over hot cooked rice garnished with lime wedges, if desired.
